Film about Norwegian fjords wins prize at Rotterdam film festival

03 Nov 2019, 10:34

A film about Norwegian nature won the public award on Saturday night at the Wildlife Film Festival in Rotterdam.
The film is about life in the deep fjords of Norway. The German documentary maker Jan Haft filmed coral reefs and luminous sea creatures, but also orcas and humpback whales swimming in the fjords.
The best short film (M6nths) is about a piglet that longs for freedom.
There were ten prizes awarded in categories such as 'Awareness Award', 'Animal Behavior' and 'Green Impact'. There was also a children's jury. He opted for a film about animal life in the vast Canadian forests.
